question:
Select the option that is related to the fifth number in the same way as the second number is related to the first number and the fourth number is related to the third number.

17 : 189 :: 13 : 69 :: 18 : ?
solution:
(a)

Logic :- (First number)2 - 100 = Second number

17 : 189 :- (17)2 - 100 ⇒ 289 - 100 = 189

13 : 69 :- (13)2 - 100 ⇒ 169 - 100 = 69

Similarly,

18 : ? :- (18)2 - 100 ⇒ 324 - 100 = 224

question:
Three statements are given followed by three conclusions numbered I, II and Ill. Assuming the statements to be true, even if they seem to be at variance with commonly known facts, decide which of the conclusions logically follow(s) from the statements.

Statements:

All males are boys.

Some teachers are boys.

All students are teachers.

Conclusions:

I. Some boys are males.

II. Some teachers are students.

lll. All males are students.
option_3: Only conclusions I and II follow
solution:
(c)

Only conclusion I and II follow.

question:
Select the set in which the numbers are related in the same way as are the numbers of the given sets.

(NOTE : Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits, E.g. 13 - Operations on 13 such as adding /subtracting /multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is not allowed)

(12, 40, 14)

(15, 33, 9)
solution:
(d)

Logic :- (Second number - First number)÷ 2 = Third number

(12, 40, 14) :- (40 - 12) ÷ 2 ⇒ (28)÷ 2 = 14

(15, 33, 9) :- (33 - 15) ÷ 2 ⇒ (18) ÷ 2 = 9

Similarly,

(21, 91, 35) :- (91 - 21)÷ 2 ⇒ (70) ÷2 = 35

question:
Which two signs should be interchanged to make the given equation correct ?

1664 ÷ 4 × 2 + 712 - 316 = 436
option_1: ÷ and +
option_2: ÷ and –
solution:
(c)

Given :- 1664 ÷ 4 × 2 + 712 - 316 = 436

After going through all options, option (c) satisfies . After interchanging - and + we get,

1664 ÷ 4 × 2 - 712 + 316

416 × 2 - 712 + 316

832 + 316 - 712

1148 - 712 = 436

L.H.S. = R.H.S

question: The second number in the given numbers-pairs is obtained by performing certain mathematical operation(s) of the first number. The same operation(s) is/are followed in all the number-pairs, except one. Find that odd number-pair.
solution:
(c)

Logic :- (First number )× 8 + 3 = (Second number)

24 , 195 :- (24) × 8 + 3 ⇒ 192 + 3 = 195

26, 211 :- (26) × 8 + 3 ⇒ 208 + 3 = 211

36, 291 :- (36) × 8 + 3 ⇒ 288 + 3 = 291

But,

25, 200 :- (25) × 8 + 3 ⇒ (200) + 3 = 203 (Not 200)

question:
Select the set in which the numbers are related in the same way as are the numbers of the given sets.

(NOTE : Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits, E.g. 13 - Operations on 13 such as adding /subtracting /multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is not allowed)

(54, 32, 66)

(49, 31, 54)
solution:
(a)

Logic :- (First number - Second number)× 3 = Third number

(54, 32,66) :- (54 - 32) × 3 ⇒ (22) × 3 = 66

(49,31,54) :- (49 - 31) × 3 ⇒ (18) × 3 = 54

Similarly,

(39, 18, 63) :- (39 - 18) × 3 ⇒ (21) × 3 = 63

question: If exactly 1 year and 2 days later it is Tuesday, then what day is it today? It is not a leap year.
solution:
(c)

We know that on moving from one normal year(non- leap year) to the previous normal year(non leap - year), the day decreased by 1.

The day after 1 year 2 days = Tuesday

On moving previous year of the day = Monday

Now subtracting 2 days = Monday - 2 = Saturday

question:
Select the set in which the numbers are related in the same way as are the numbers of the given sets.

(NOTE : Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits, E.g. 13 - Operations on 13 such as adding /subtracting /multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is not allowed)

(36, 6, 18)

(35, 5, 21)
solution:
(a)

Logic :- [(First number) ÷ Second number] × 3 = Third number

(36, 6, 18) :- (36 ÷ 6)× 3 ⇒ (6) × (3) = 18

(35, 5, 21) :- (35 ÷ 5) × 3 ⇒ (7) × (3) = 21

Similarly,

(49, 7, 21) :- (49 ÷ 7) × 3 ⇒ (7) × (3) = 21

question:
Select the correct combination of mathematical signs to sequentially replace the * signs and to balance the given equation.

17 * 21 * 7 * 5 * 4 * 34
option_1: ÷ , – , +, × , =
option_2: – , ÷ , +, × , =
option_3: +, × , ÷ , – , =
option_4: × , – , ÷ , +, =
solution:
(b)

Given :- 17 * 21 * 7 * 5 * 4 * 34

After going through all the options, option (b) satisfies.

17 – 21 ÷ 7 + 5 × 4 = 34

17 – 3 + 20

37 – 3 = 34

L.H.S. = R.H.S.

question: The cultivation of _____ was introduced on the Baba Budan Hills in India.
solution: (c)Coffee. Baba Budan introduced the coffee plant to Chikkamanglur, Karnataka in 1670. Growth of coffee was encouraged during the time of General Sir Mark Cubbon in 1834.Types of coffee bean: Arabica, Robusta, Excelsa and Liberica. Coffee producer country: 1st - Brazil. 2nd- Vietnam.

question: Due to the attraction of the sun and the moon, what is the frequency of up and falls of ocean water in a day?
solution: (a)Two. When the Earth, Sun, and Moon line up, their gravitational power combines to make exceptionally high tides where the bulges occur, called spring tides, as well as very low tides where the water has been displaced. When the Sun is at a right angle to the Moon, moderate tides, called neap tides. There are generally three types of tides: diurnal - one high and low tide each day, semi-diurnal - two high and low tides each day, and mixed - two high and low tides each day of different heights.

question: RG Bhandarkar was a popular leader of which reformed society ?
solution: (a)Prarthana Samaj was founded by Atmaram Pandurang with the help of Keshav Chandra Sen in 1867. Brahmo Samaj (1828) is also known as Brahma Samaj and Brahma Sabha. It was the first modern Hindu reform movement founded by Raja Rammohun Roy. Arya Samaj founded in 1875 by Dayananda Sarasvati. The Theosophical Society was formed in New York City in 1875 by Helena Petrovna Blavatsky, Colonel Henry Steel Olcott.

question: Sports Authority of India, the apex body for sports promotion, was set up in the year ________.
solution: (c)1984. Sports Authority of India (SAI): Headquarters - New Delhi. Founder - Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports. Sports Organization and Headquarters : Board of Control for Cricket in India (Mumbai) - 1928. Indian Olympic Association (New Delhi) - 1927, All India Football Federation (New Delhi) - 1937. All India Council of Sports (AICS) established in 1950.

question: 3_______ was the first woman to be ordained as a bhikkhuni in Buddhism.
solution: (c)Mahapajapati Gotami. Sanghamitta was an Indian Buddhist nun and the eldest daughter of Ashoka. Sujata fed Gautama Buddha a bowl of kheera, a milk-rice pudding, ending his six years of asceticism. Venerable Dhammananda Bhikkhuni is the first fully ordained Theravadin nun in Thailand.

question: A non-SI unit called ‘nit’ is the unit of which of the following photometric quantities used to measure a multitude of light intensity?
solution: (b)Luminance. One lux is the amount of illumination provided when one lumen is evenly distributed over an area of one square meter. The candela is the unit of luminous intensity. Luminous emittance (luminous exitance) is the luminous flux per unit area emitted from a surface. A luminance meter is a device used in photometry that can measure the luminance in a particular direction and with a particular solid angle. Photometric or luminous exposure is the accumulated physical quantity of visible light energy per area applied to a surface during a given exposure time.

question: On 29 July 2021, the Government of India launched Vidya Pravesh, a preschool preparation programme for ______ students, preparing the children for school.
solution: 3(c)Class first. Vidya Pravesh module duration of three months or 12 weeks for all children who have entered Grade 1. Sarva Siksha Abhiyan (2001). It was pioneered by Atal Bihari Vajpayee. It aimed to provide elementary education to all children in the age group of 6 to 14. Mid Day Meal Scheme (1995) and new name is POSHAN Scheme.

question: The origin of Directive Principles of State Policy can be traced to which of the following?
solution: (d)Karachi Resolution (1931). The Resolution is three pages long and is mostly written in a quasi-legal style. Karachi Session of Congress in 1931 was presided by Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel. Gandhi Irwin Pact - 5 March 1931. It marked the end of civil disobedience. Poona Pact (September 24th, 1932) was an agreement between M K Gandhi and B R Ambedkar signed in the Yerwada Central Jail. Second Round Table Conference was held in London 7 September 1931 to 1 December 1931 with the participation of Gandhi and the Indian National Congress.

question: Industries are classified into ______ categories in the Industrial Policy Resolution.
solution: (c)Three.The Industrial Policy Resolution (IPR) 1956. Category 1: Those industries that were established and owned exclusively by the public sector. Category 2: Those industries in which the public sector would perform the primary role while the private sector would play the secondary role. Category 3: Those industries that are not included in Category 1 and Category 2 were left to the private sector.

question: ‘Wings’ is associated with which of the following sports events?
solution: (a)Paralympic 2020. The first-ever Paralympics Games was held in 1960. Although the ancient Games were staged in Olympia, Greece, from 776 BC. The first modern Olympics were held in Athens, Greece, in 1896. Baron Pierre de Coubertin was the founder of the modern Olympic Games.

question: Which of the following is not a freshwater lake in India?
solution: (a)Pulicat Lake (Andhra Pradesh) is the second largest brackish water lagoon in India, (after Chilika Lake, Odisha).Loktak (Manipur) is a freshwater lake in Northeast India. Naini Tal, also known as Naini Lake, is a natural freshwater body (Nainital in Kumaon, Uttarakhand India). Bhimtal (largest lake of Nainital) - Uttarakhand. Wular Lake (Jammu and Kashmir). Sambhar Salt Lake (Rajasthan) is India's largest saline lake.

question: Single-celled life forms were discovered by Antom Van Leeuwenhoek in ______.
solution: (d)1674. Leeuwenhoek - The father of microbiology. Important Discovery : He discovered microscopic lens, Single-Celled Life, The shape and size of Red Blood Cells, Spermatozoa, Lymphatic Capillaries. He discovered both protists and bacteria.

question:
Match the following neighboring countries of India with their official languages.

Country Official Language

1. Sri Lanka a. Dzongkha

2. Bhutan b. Burmese

3. Myanmar c. Sinhala
solution: (c)1-c, 2-a, 3-b. Countries and their Language: Laos - Lao, Thailand - Thai, Afghanistan- Dari/Pashto, Cambodia - Khmer, Iran - Persian, Maldives - Dhivehi, Pakistan - Urdu, Yemen, Lebanon, UAE - Arabic, Israel - Hebrew.

question: Who led the Revolt of 1857 in Bihar?
solution: (c)Veer Kunwar Singh. Leaders and the Centres of Revolt 1857: Bakht Khan (Delhi), Nana Saheb (Kanpur), Begum Hazrat Mahal (Lucknow), Khan Bahadur (Bareilly), Kunwar Singh (Bihar), Rani Laxmibai (Jhansi). Azimullah Khan was initially appointed Secretary, and later Prime Minister to Maratha Peshwa Nana Saheb II.

question: Thabal Chongba is a folk dance of which Indian state?
solution: (c)Manipur. Folk dances : Goa - Ghode Modni, Dhangar Dance, Goff Talgadi, Shigmo and Mussel khel. Mizoram - Chailam, Cheraw, Khuallam, Bamboo dance. West Bengal - Chhau dance Cheraw dance, Rasa lila. Manipur - Ballet and Drama, Udukhol, Basak, Goura Lila, Nupi Pala, Dhop Kirtan, Malabi, Pung Cholom.

question: Sisodiya Rajput ruler of Mewar, Amar Singh accepted Mughal services during the reign of ________.
solution: (b)Jahangir. Amar singh was the eldest son and successor of Maharana Pratap. Akbar (1556–1605). Aurangzeb belonged to the aristocratic Timurid dynasty, and held administrative and military posts under his father Shah Jahan (1628 – 1658). Babur (1526 – 30) was the founder of the Mughal Empire.

question: Select the incorrect statement about Gymnosperms.
option_1: Gymnosperms are found as woody shrubs, trees or lianas and include no true aquatics and few epiphytes.
option_2: Gymnosperms are seedless flowering plants.
option_3: Gymnosperms are typically slow in terms of reproduction; up to a year may pass between pollination and fertilization and seed maturation may require 3 years.
option_4: Gymnosperms exhibit cones or storbili and naked seeds, but not flowers.
solution: (b)Gymnosperms are flowerless, seed-producing plants. They belong to the subkingdom Embophyta. The term "gymnosperm" literally means "naked seed." This is because the seeds produced by gymnosperms are not encased in an ovary. Examples:- Cycas, Pinus, Araucaria, Thuja, Cedrus, Picea, Abies, Juniperus.

question: The total number of Ministers, including the Chief Minister, in the Council of Ministers in a State shall not exceed ______ of the total number of members of the Legislative Assembly of that State.
solution: (c)Fifteen percent. Article 164 (1A) - The strength of a council headed by the Chief Minister cannot exceed 15% of the strength of the assembly. The Chief Minister (CM) is the head of the state council of ministers. CM functions: He recommends to the governor on who to appoint as ministers. He designates or reshuffles the portfolios of the ministers. He can ask a minister to resign.

question: Identify an application in which solar cells are not used.
solution: (c)Lift system. A solar cell (photovoltaic cell) is an electronic device that converts the energy of light directly into electricity by the photovoltaic effect. Artificial intelligence (John McCarthy) is the simulation of human intelligence processes by machines, especially computer systems. Radio is the technology of signaling and communicating using radio waves (frequency between 3 Hz and 3,000 GHz).

question: Diwali falls in which of the following months of the Hindu calendar?
solution: (d)Kartika. Festivals following Hindu calendar: Chaitra - Ugadi, Gudi Padwa, Ram Navami; Vaishakha - Parashurama Jayanti, Akshaya Tritiya, Mohini Ekadashi; Jyeshtha - Dussehra; Ashadha - Jagannath Rath Yatra, Guru Purnima; Shavana - Raksha Bandhan, Nag Panchmi; Bhadrapada - Janmashtami, Hartalika Teej, Ganesh Chaturthi; Ashwin - Durga Puja; Kartika - Dhanteras, Diwali, Bhai Dooj, Karwa Chauth.

question: The biennial tri-services amphibious exercise, AMPHEX 2023 was conducted in _______ from 17 to 22 January 2023.
solution: (d)Andhra Pradesh. Some of the recent military exercises of India 2023 are Harimau Shakti (India and Malaysia), Yudh Abhyas exercise ( India and the US), Exercise Pitch Black {(a biennial warfare exercise hosted by the Royal Australian Air Force (RAAF)}, Khanjar (India and Kyrgyzstan), VARUNA (India and France), Dharma Guardian (India and Japan), EX-DUSTLIK (India and Uzbekistan), EKUVERIN (India and Maldives).

question: Padmaja Reddy, who was conferred the Padma Shri in 2022, is renowned for which of the following dance forms?
solution: (a)Kuchipudi. Awards of Padmaja Reddy: Sangeet Natak Akademi (first person of Telangana get this award, 2015), Kala Ratna (2006). Dances, origin and their famous Proponents: Kuchipudi (Andhra Pradesh) - Radha Reddy, Raja Reddy, Indrani Rehman. Bharatnatyam (Tamil Nadu) - Lakshmi Vishwanathan, Padm Subramaniam, Mrinalini Sarabhai, Mallika Sarabhai. Odissi (Odisha) - Guru Pankaj Chanran Das, Kelu Charan Mohaptra, Sonal Mansingh, Sharon Lowen. Kathak (Uttar Pradesh) - Birju Maharaj, Lacchu Maharaj, Sitara Devi, Damyanti Joshi.

question: Select the correct sequence of the musical instruments according to the given sequence of their associated personalities : Ustad Allah Rakha, Totaram Sharma, TH Vinayakam.
solution: (c)Tabla, Pakhawaj, Ghatam. Musical Instruments and associated personalities: Tabla - Zakir Hussain, Sabir Khan, Kishan Maharaj, Jnan Prakash Ghosh. Pakhawaj - Bhavani Shankar, Ayodhya Prasad. Ghatam - E.M. Subramaniam. Flute - Hari Prasad Chaurasia, Pannalal Ghosh, Palladam Sanjiv Rao. Guitar - Braj Bhushan Kabra. Karthal - Gazi Khan Barna. Santoor - Shiv Kumar Sharma, Bhajan Sopori, Tarun Bhattacharya. Sarod - Allauddin Khan, Ali Akbar Khan, Amjad Ali Khan, Tejendra Majumdar.

question: What is the name of the scheme launched in 2022 for the welfare measures of the transgeneder community and for persons who are engaged in the act of begging?
solution: (a)SMILE (Support for Marginalized Individuals for livelihood and Enterprise). Launched by Virendra Singh (union minister of Social justice and Empowerment) in February 2022.The Ministry has allocated Rs. 365 Crore for the scheme from 2021-22 to 2025-26. Components: Scholarships for Transgender Students, Skill Development and Livelihood, Composite Medical Health. Other Schemes for Transgenders: Sweekruti Scheme (Odisha), Shelter Homes for Transgender Persons (Gujrat).

question: GDP deflator = _______
option_1: (Nominal GDP × Real GDP) × 100
option_2: (Nominal GDP + Real GDP) × 100
option_3: (Nominal GDP - Real GDP) × 100
option_4: (Nominal GDP / Real GDP) × 100
solution: (d)(Nominal GDP / Real GDP) × 100. Gross national product (GNP) is the value of all finished goods and services produced by a country's citizens, both domestically and abroad. NNP = GNP – Depreciation. Gross National Product (GNP) is the total value of all finished goods and services produced by a country's citizens in a given financial year.

question: If a2 + b2 + c2 =ab + bc + ac, then the value of 11a4 + 13b4+ 17c417a2b2 + 9b2c2 + 15c2a2 is:
solution:
(a)

a2 + b2 + c2 = ab + bc + ac …..(Given)

only possible when , a = b = c

So, 11a4 + 13b4 + 17c417a2b2 + 9b2c2 + 15c2a2 = 11a4 + 13a4 + 17a4 17a2a2 + 9a2a2 + 15a2a2= 41a441a4=1

question: D and E points on the sides AB and AC, respectively, of ΔABC such that DE is parallel to BC and AD : DB = 7 : 9. If CD and BE intersect each other at F, then find the ratio of areas of ΔDEF and ΔCBF.
solution:
(c)

By using thales theorem ,

ADAB = DEBC ⇒DEBC = 716

So, area (ΔDEF) : area (ΔCBF)

= 72 : 162= 49 : 256

question: A and B are equally efficient and each could individually complete a piece of work in 30 days, if none took any holiday. A and B started working together on this piece of work, but A took a day off after every four days of work, while B took a day off after every five days of work. If the duo had started work on 01 August 2022, on which date was the work completed ?
solution:
(d)

Let efficiency of each A and B be 1 unit

Then, total work = 30 × 1 = 30 unit

According to the question,

Work done in one cycle (6 days) = A(4 + 1) + B(5) = 10 units

Work done in three cycle (18 days) = 10 × 3 = 30 units

So, work will be completed on 18 August 2022 .

question: A conical tent with radius 6 units and height 8 units is to be made by canvas. How much canvas is needed to make the tent? (Rounded off of two places of decimals)
solution:
(a)Slant height of canvas (l) = 62+ 82 = 10

Canvas needed (πrl) = 227 × 6 × 10 = 188.57 units

question: The smallest number added to 888 so that it is exactly divisible by 35 is :
solution:
(a)By checking option one by one , only option (a) satisfied

888 + 2235= 26

question: The square of the difference between two given natural numbers is 324, while the product of these two given numbers is 144. Find the positive difference between the squares of these two given numbers.
solution:
(b)

(x - y)2 = 324 ⇒x-y = 18

(x + y)2 = (x - y)2 + 4xy

x + y2 = 324 + 4 × 144 =900x + y =30Now,x2 - y2 =x - y (x + y) = 18 × 30 = 540

question: A alone can finish a work in 15 days. A work only for the first two days and last two days. The rest work is done by B and the work is completed in 20 days. In how many days A and B together can finish the work?
solution:
(c)

Let total work = 15 units

Then , efficiency of A = 1 unit

Four days work of A = 4 × 1 = 4 units

Remaining work = 11 units

Now, B complete the remaining work in 16 days

So, efficiency of B = 1116

Combined efficiency of A and B = 1 + 1116 = 2716

Hence, Time taken by A and B together to complete the work = 152716 = 809 days

question: The value of {51 ÷ { 25 + (25 of 12 ÷ 30) - (54 ÷ 5 of 125)} is :
solution:
(b)

{51 ÷ { 25 + (25 of 12 ÷ 30)-(54 ÷ 5 of 125)}

= {51 ÷ { 25 + (300 ÷ 30) - (54 ÷ 625)}

= {51 ÷ { 25 + (10) - (625 ÷ 625)}

= {51 ÷ { 25 + (10) - (1)}

= 5134 = 32

question: If sin(5x - 25°) = cos(5y + 25°), where 5x - 25° and 5y + 25° are acute angles, then the value of (x + y) is :
solution:
(c)

sinA = cosB ⇒ A + B = 90°

sin(5x - 25°) = cos(5y + 25°)

5x - 25° + 5y + 25° = 90°

5x + 5y = 90°

x + y = 905 = 18°

question: A and B can finish a work in 10 days, B and C can finish it in 12 days and C and A can finish in 6 days. In how many days A alone can finish the work ?
solution:
(c)

Efficiency of A , B and C together = 6 + 5 + 102 = 212 units

Efficiency of A = (212 - 5)= 5.5 units

Time taken by A to complete the work alone = 605.5 = 12011 days


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/admin/resources/qdocs/test-1-EN-1/1694425352/word/media/image52.png

question:
A toffee company prepares toffee of two different flavours X and Y. The production of two flavours over a period of 4 years is expressed in the bar graph given below.

What is the difference between the average production of flavour X in 2017 and 2018 and the average production of flavour Y in 2019 and 2020.


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/admin/resources/qdocs/test-1-EN-1/1694425352/word/media/image54.png
solution:
(a)

Average production of flavour X in 2017 and 2018 = 20 + 202 × 1000 = 20, 000 packs

Average production of flavour Y in 2019 and 2020 = 32 + 202 × 1000 = 26,000 packs

Required difference = 26000 - 20000 = 6000 packs

question: According to Raghav, his weight is more than 64 kg but less than 74 kg. His sister does not agree with Raghv and she thinks that his weight is more than 60 kg but less than 69 kg. His mother’s view is that his weight cannot be more than 68 kg. His father’s view is that his weight cannot be more than 67 kg. If all are them are correct in their estimation, then what is the average of different probable weights of Raghav measures (in kg)?
solution:
(a)

Raghav’s opinion = 64 < x < 74 (65 to 73)

His sister’s opinion = 60 < x < 69 (61 to 68)

His mother’s opinion = x ≤ 68

His fathers’s opinion = x ≤ 67

Here , possible values are 65 , 66 , 67

So, required average = 66 kg.

question: The marked price of a ceiling fan is ₹4,200 and the shopkeeper allows a discount of 5% on it. If his profit is 14%, then the cost price of the fan is:
solution:
(d)

CPMP = 100 - discount %100 + profit % CP4200 = 100 - 5100 + 14

Cost price = 4200 × 95114 = ₹3,500

question: Which of the following is a false statement ?
option_1: tan²A = 1 - sec²A
option_3: cosec²A - 1 = cot²A
option_4: cos A × sec A = 1
solution:
(a)

As we know:- tan²A + 1 = sec²A

Clearly , option(a) is wrong.

question: If in ΔXYZ, XY = 4 and XZ = 5 cm and Q is a point on YZ such that XQ bisects ∠X, then YQ : QZ is :
solution:
(d)

The angle bisector of a triangle divides the opposite side into two parts , proportional to the other two sides of the triangle.

XYXZ = YQQZ ⇒ YQQZ = 45


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/admin/resources/qdocs/test-1-EN-1/1694425352/word/media/image56.png

question: A train traveling at 70 km/h crosses another train traveling in the same direction at 34 km/h in 25 seconds. What is the combined length of both the trains (in metres)?
solution:
(b)

Relative speed of both train = (70 - 34) × 518 = 10 m/s

Time taken by trains to cross each other = 25 sec

So, combined length of the trains = 25 × 10 = 250 meter

question: In a constituency, 85% of the total number of people on the electoral roll cast their votes during an election. 10% of the votes cast were declared invalid. If there were 3,00,000 people on the electoral roll and Dharam secured 1,37,700 valid votes, what percentage of the total number of valid votes did Dharam secure?
solution:
(d)

Total valid votes = 3,00,000 × 85100× 90100 = 2,29,500

Total valid votes secured by Dharam = 1,37,700

So, required % = 137700229500 × 100 = 60%

question:
Find the value of the following expression.

12(sin4θ + cos4θ ) + 18(sin6θ + cos6θ ) + 78sin2θcos2θ
solution:
(a)

12(sin4θ + cos4θ ) + 18(sin6θ + cos6θ ) + 78sin2θcos2θ

Put θ = 0°

= 12 (0 + 1) + 18(0 + 1) + 78 × 0 × 1

= 30

question: ΔPQR is an equilateral triangle inscribed in a circle. S is any point on the arc QR. find the measure of ∠PSQ.
solution:
(b)

Angle made by the same arc at the circumference of the circle always be equal .

∠PRQ = ∠PSQ = 60° …..(angle made by arc PQ)

question:
The given table shows the percentage of marks obtained by five students in five different subjects in a school.

What is Hitansh’s overall percentage (rounded up to 2 decimal places) in the examination?


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/images/mceu_6302245711695794599438.png
solution:
(a)

Total marks of in all 5 subjects = 550

Total marks obtained by Hitansh in all 5 subject =

100 × 67100+ 150 × 70100+ 100 × 64100+ 100 × 55100+ 100 × 75100

= 67 + 105 + 64 + 55 + 75 = 366

So, Required % = 366550 × 100 = 66.55%

question: In a 1500 m race, X beats Y by 100 m and X beats Z by 240 m. By what distance does Y beat Z in the same race?
solution:
(c)

Z : X : Y

1500 : 1400

1260 : 1500

-----------------------------

126 : 150 : 140

So, Y beat Z by = (140 - 126) = 14 units

According to the question,

140 units = 1500

Then, So, Y beat Z by = 1500140 × 14= 150 m

question: If the cost of 120 m of cloth is ₹9,600, then what will be the cost of 147 m of that cloth?
solution:
(c)

Cost of 147 meter cloths = 9600120 × 147 = ₹11,760

question: If , (x + 1x) = 5 and x > 1, what is the value of (x8 - 1x8)?
solution:
(a)

(x + 1x)=5 x2 + 1x2 = (5)2 - 2 = 23 And, x4 + 1x4= (23)2 - 2 = 527 ----------(1) Now, x - 1x = 52 - 4 = 21 x2 - 1x2 = (x + 1x)(x - 1x) = 521 And , x4 - 1x4 = (x2 + 1x2)(x2 - 1x2) = 23 × 521 = 11521 ----------------(2) Now, x8 - 1 x8= (x4 + 1x4)(x4-1x4) = 527 × 11521 = 6060521

question: In how many years will a sum of ₹9,500 amount to ₹11,780 at the rate of 8% per annum at simple interest?
solution:
(a)

According to the question,

Simple interest = 11,780 - 9,500 = ₹2,280

2280 = 9500 × 8 × t100

Time (t) = 228095 × 8 = 3 years

question: By selling a watch for ₹2,000, a shopkeeper loses 20%. How much would he gain or lose by selling it for ₹3,000.
solution:
(a)

Cost price of the watch = 2000 × 10080 = ₹2500

Selling price of the watch = ₹3000

Required % = 3000 - 25002500 × 100 = 20% gain

question:
The following sentence has been divided into three segments, A, B, C. One of them may contain a grammatical error. Select the segment that contains the error, from the given options. If you don’t find any error, mark ‘No error’ as your answer.

Aniket lives (A) / in the small apartment (B) / in the suburbs (C).
solution:
(c)in the small apartment

Article ‘the’ must be replaced with ‘a’ as ‘small apartment’ mentioned in the given sentence is not specific and we generally use the indefinite article ‘a’ before a non-specific noun. Hence, ‘in a small apartment’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym for the highlighted word.

The government’s utilitarian stance was appreciated by all.
solution:
(c)Useful- having a practical purpose or use.

Utilitarian- designed to be useful and practical.

Thrust- push or force something strongly.

Fanciful- full of imagination or fantasy.

Distasteful- unpleasant to the taste or smell.

question: Describe how you will tell everyone that Mr. Akhil opened the gate in passive voice.
option_1: The gate was opened by Mr. Akhil
option_3: The gate been open by Mr. Akhil.
solution:
(a) The gate was opened by Mr. Akhil.(Correct)

(b) Mr. Akhil open the gate.(Incorrect Sentence Structure)

(c) The gate been open by Mr. Akhil.(Incorrect Tense)

(d) The gate opened by Mr. Akhil.(‘Was’ is Missing)

question: Select the incorrectly spelt word.
solution:
(a)Aristocrate

‘Aristocrat’ is the correct spelling.

question:
Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence.

I have not seen you for last year.
solution:
(a) you since last year

‘Since’ is used to denote a point of time in the past whereas ‘for’ is used for a fixed period of time(countable) like 2 years, 3 months. Hence, ‘since last year’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the incorrectly spelt word in the given sentence.

It is wierd to overreact on the consequences like this, it didn’t even matter at the end of the day.
solution:
(c)Wierd

‘Weird’ is the correct spelling.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence.

I don’t wear the sunglasses at the moment.
solution:
(d)I’m not wearing

The phrase ‘at the moment’ describes an action happening right now. And we generally use present continuous tense(is/am/are + V-ing) to denote an action happening at the current moment. Hence, ‘I’m not wearing’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.

A person who draws or produces maps
solution:
(d)Cartographer- a person who draws or produces maps.

Calligrapher- a person who writes beautifully and artistically.

Choreographer- a person who designs and creates dance movements.

Chauffeur- a person hired to drive others’ cars.

question:
Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence.

Her hopes for building her own house were beaten when she lost her jewellery box.
solution:
(d)house were dashed when

‘Beaten’ must be replaced with ‘dashed’ as ‘dashed’ means destroyed or ruined. Hence, ‘house were dashed when’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the underlined word.

The outcome document of the Rio+20 Conference, the Future We Want, underscores climate change as “ an inevitable and urgent global challenge with long-term implications for the sustainable development of all countries''. Through the document, Members State express their concern about the continuous rising of emissions of greenhouse gases and the vulnerability of all countries, particularly developing countries, to the adverse impacts of climate change.
solution:
(b)Undeniable- something impossible to deny or disprove.

Inevitable- something that is bound to happen.

Immemorable- something that cannot be remembered.

Adventurous- something full of excitement and risk.

Escapable- something that can be avoided.

question:
Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.

Being careful that every detail of something is correct
solution:
(a)Fastidious-being careful that every detail of something is correct.

Squeamish- being easily disgusted by unpleasant things.

Stubborn- refusing to change one's opinion.

Impregnable- powerful and impossible to beat.

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.

Through thick and thin
option_3: In good times and in bad times
solution:
(c)Through thick and thin- in good times and in bad times.

E.g.- She stood by him through thick and thin, supporting him through all situations.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the underlined word.

The committee wanted us to explain this in detail.
solution:
(a)Elaborate-add more information or details to explain something further.

Explain- make something clear or provide details to help someone understand.

Trouble- difficulty or problems.

Collect- gather or bring together.

Keen- really interested or excited about something.

question:
Sentences of a paragraph are given below in jumbled order. Arrange the sentences in the correct order to form a meaningful and coherent paragraph.

A. But, while the court’s action solved one problem, it created another and because of the closure, many workers lost their jobs.

B. For instance, the courts directed industries in residential areas in Delhi to close down or shift out of the city.

C. In recent years, while the courts have come out with strong orders on environmental issues, these have sometimes affected people’s livelihoods adversely.

D. Several of these industries were polluting the neighbourhood and discharge from these industries were polluting the river Yamuna because they had been set up without following the rules.
solution:
(a)CBDA

Sentence C will be the starting line as it contains the main subject of the parajumble i.e. courts' orders on environmental issues. And, Sentence B states the courts' directions regarding industries in residential areas. So, B will follow C. Further, Sentence D states the industries’ failure to follow the rules & Sentence A states the negative impact on workers due to the closure of industries. So, A will follow D. Going through the options, option (a) has the correct sequence.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.

Consequence
solution:
(a)Outcome- the final result or conclusion of a process or situation.

Consequence- the result or effect of an action or event.

Origin- the source or starting point of something.

Start- the initial point or beginning of something.

Begin- to start or initiate an action or process.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.

There are rows of chairs on either side of the ______.
solution:
(d) aisle

‘Aisle’ means a narrow space between rows of seats or shelves. The given sentence states that there are rows of chairs on both sides of the aisle. Hence, ‘aisle’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.

It turns out to be a blessing in disguise.
option_1: Has a good effect even though at first it seemed it would be bad
option_2: When a simple solution solves a problem very well
option_3: Has a very good effect on a situation or a thing
option_4: When things get better and better when least expecting it
solution:
(a) It turns out to be a blessing in disguise- has a good effect even though at first it seemed it would be bad.

E.g.- Losing the job was a blessing in disguise. It led to a better opportunity.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.

Unbiased
solution:
(b)Objective - based on facts rather than feelings or opinions.

Unbiased - not influenced by personal feelings or opinions.

Organisational - relating to the structure and management of an organization.

Definitive - clear, certain, and leaving no doubt.

Subjective - influenced by personal opinions, feelings, or perspectives.

question:
The following sentence has been divided into parts. One of them may contain an error. Select the part that contains the error, form the given options. If you don’t find any error, mark ‘No error’ as your answer.

The present-century threats to our environment, / which include interfering species, ailments, pollution and / a boiling temperature, were putting wildlife populations at peril.
option_1: which include interfering species, ailments, pollution and
option_3: a boiling temperature, were putting wildlife populations at peril
solution:
(c) a boiling temperature, were putting wildlife populations at peril.

'Were' must be replaced with 'are' as the given sentence states an action in present tense, clearly indicated by the term 'The present-century'. So we need to use present continuous tense(are + V1-ing). Hence, 'are putting wildlife populations at peril' is the most appropriate answer.

question: Describe how you will tell your friends that Mr. Ram uses multimedia for teaching the children in passive voice.
option_1: Multimedia is using for teaching the children.
option_2: Multimedia is used by Mr. Ram for teaching the children.
option_3: Multimedia is used for teach the children by Mr. Ram.
option_4: Mr. Ram use multimedia for teaching the children.
solution:
(b) Multimedia is used by Mr. Ram for teaching the children.(Correct)

(a) Multimedia is using for teaching the children.(Incorrect Form of the Verb)

(c) Multimedia is used for teach the children by Mr. Ram.(Incorrect form of Verb)

(d) Mr. Ram use multimedia for teaching the children.(Incorrect Sentence Structure)

question:
Cloze Test:

Socrates is flying. No, he is (96) ______. The wings behind him beat in a calming rhythm (97) ______ the cool air rushes past. His wings are all that matter, (98) ______ at the rushing wind like the sails of some great sea vessel, the feathery appendages all he is and all he will ever want to be. His back muscles flex with the (99) ______ that takes him high above the ground. He feels the effort, of course, but sweeping into the sky does not require much of one. The (100) ______ is pleasurable, even exhilarating. With flight there is freedom beyond description, an ecstasy bordering on emotional.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank no. 96.
solution:
(a)Soaring

‘Soaring’ means flying high in the air. The given passage states that Socrates is flying high in the air. Hence, ‘soaring’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test:

Socrates is flying. No, he is (96) ______. The wings behind him beat in a calming rhythm (97) ______ the cool air rushes past. His wings are all that matter, (98) ______ at the rushing wind like the sails of some great sea vessel, the feathery appendages all he is and all he will ever want to be. His back muscles flex with the (99) ______ that takes him high above the ground. He feels the effort, of course, but sweeping into the sky does not require much of one. The (100) ______ is pleasurable, even exhilarating. With flight there is freedom beyond description, an ecstasy bordering on emotional.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank no.97.
solution:
(d)While

‘While’ is used to connect two events happening at the same time. Similarly, in the given sentence, two events are beating and rushing, which are happening at the same time. Hence, 'while' is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test:

Socrates is flying. No, he is (96) ______. The wings behind him beat in a calming rhythm (97) ______ the cool air rushes past. His wings are all that matter, (98) ______ at the rushing wind like the sails of some great sea vessel, the feathery appendages all he is and all he will ever want to be. His back muscles flex with the (99) ______ that takes him high above the ground. He feels the effort, of course, but sweeping into the sky does not require much of one. The (100) ______ is pleasurable, even exhilarating. With flight there is freedom beyond description, an ecstasy bordering on emotional.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank no.98.
solution:
(b)Snapping

‘Snapping’ means to make quick movements. The given passage states that his wings are moving quickly at the rushing wind. Hence, ‘snapping’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test:

Socrates is flying. No, he is (96) ______. The wings behind him beat in a calming rhythm (97) ______ the cool air rushes past. His wings are all that matter, (98) ______ at the rushing wind like the sails of some great sea vessel, the feathery appendages all he is and all he will ever want to be. His back muscles flex with the (99) ______ that takes him high above the ground. He feels the effort, of course, but sweeping into the sky does not require much of one. The (100) ______ is pleasurable, even exhilarating. With flight there is freedom beyond description, an ecstasy bordering on emotional.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank no.99.
solution:
(b)Effort

'Effort' means the physical or mental energy that is required to do something. The given passage states that his back muscles flex with the effort . Hence, 'effort' is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test:

Socrates is flying. No, he is (96) ______. The wings behind him beat in a calming rhythm (97) ______ the cool air rushes past. His wings are all that matter, (98) ______ at the rushing wind like the sails of some great sea vessel, the feathery appendages all he is and all he will ever want to be. His back muscles flex with the (99) ______ that takes him high above the ground. He feels the effort, of course, but sweeping into the sky does not require much of one. The (100) ______ is pleasurable, even exhilarating. With flight there is freedom beyond description, an ecstasy bordering on emotional.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank no. 100.
solution:
(a)Sensation

‘Sensation’ means a feeling or experience. The given passage states that the feeling is pleasurable and exciting. Hence, ‘sensation’ is the most appropriate answer.
